heading: Are Corn Tortillas gluten free?
intro: This public analysis report explains the biggest gluten risks in Corn Tortillas and how to order more safely.

verdict.summary: Corn tortillas are generally gluten-free, but there is a risk of cross-contamination during processing or preparation. It's important to ensure that they are made in a gluten-free facility or are labeled as gluten-free.

disclaimer: This guidance is informational only. Always verify ingredients and preparation with the restaurant.

sections.title: Quick answer
sections.body: Corn Tortillas can vary by recipe, ingredients, and cross-contact controls in the kitchen.

sections.title: Common gluten risks
sections.body: Watch for hidden sources like soy sauce, malt flavoring, marinades, thickeners, and shared fryers.

sections.title: How BiteRight helps
sections.body: Scan menus and ingredient labels with BiteRight to get a localized gluten-risk breakdown in seconds.

risk: Cross-contamination with wheat flour during production
Shared cooking surfaces or utensils with gluten-containing products
Certain brands that may use additives containing gluten
safe: Corn tortillas labeled gluten-free (e.g., Mission Gluten Free Corn Tortillas)
Tortillas made from 100% corn without additives
Brands like La Banderita Corn Tortillas that specify gluten-free

faq.question: Can BiteRight confirm if Corn Tortillas are gluten free?
faq.answer: BiteRight highlights likely gluten risks based on ingredients and preparation. Always confirm with the kitchen if you have coeliac disease.

faq.question: What should I ask a restaurant?
faq.answer: Ask about shared equipment, sauces, marinades, and whether the kitchen has a dedicated gluten-free prep area.
